comments.body: @Flarna is there any update? This just seems like a formatting change and tests are passing as they were

There were passing at the time the last change was done in this module but now they fail (see e.g. https://travis-ci.org/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/builds/428047718?utm_source=github_status&utm_medium=notification).

The cause why it fails now without any change in your type definition is that the typescript version used to test has been upgraded.
Oh, didn't notice that, I'll check why exactly does this not pass anymore, but this is completely ok. Good catch :)

Old TS versions report the error on the `format` call whereas the latest one reports on the concrete property in the passed argument which doesn't match (`messageType` in this case).
I think TS@next is really nice if you pass objects with a lot properties as you get a direct pointer to the property which doesn't match.

Here in the tests it's annoying; would be good if the test framework would allow to specify a range or the typescript version. But this is out of scope for me :grin:
